titleStmt.title: Woolfolk et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG1426

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1859-1862

body.p: The following resolutions were adopted this day at a Meeting of the Citizans of Paducha Wharras the Neutrality of of Ky was Violated on Yesterday by the invasion of Ballard Co and the Seizure of two Citzans by Federal Troops from Caro & this Morning by one of the Federal Gun Boats coming up the Rivr and Seizing at the Paduch Wharf & Carrying away the Steam Terry Therefore. Resolved we do hereby advise the Governer of this State of these Flagrans invasions of the Soil of Ky= and of her Neutrality, & that we require of the Authorities of the State protection from high handed Acts of Aggression Soon No doubt to be Extended to the Capture and Extradition of othe Citizans & hereby request of the Governor. officeially to declare the Neutrality of Saverngnty of Kentucky violated & declare also that if Ky cannot or will not protect our property & persons we will Esteem our onley refuge to appeal to Tennessee Troop for that protection which our State May fail to afford That we immedeally Communicate these Resolution to the Govennor and request an immediate answer by Telgra'ph

Mayor Sawner, Genarl Allen Bigger
Fowler Harris Jr. Comm -- ,"
